etymologies: early 18th century: perhaps of imitative origin

definitions: scrape or brush the surface of (a shoe or other object) against something

examples.text: I scuffed the heel of my shoe on a stone

shortDefinitions: scrape or brush surface of shoe or other object against something

definitions: mark (a surface) by scraping or brushing it, especially with one's shoes

examples.text: the linoleum on the floor was scuffed

definitions: (of an object or surface) become marked by scraping or brushing
shortDefinitions: become marked by scraping or brushing

definitions: drag (one's feet or heels) when walking
shortDefinitions: drag one's feet or heels when walking

definitions: walk while dragging one's feet or heels

examples.text: she scuffed along in her slippers

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: walk while dragging one's feet or heels

definitions: a mark made by scraping or grazing a surface or object
shortDefinitions: mark made by scraping or grazing surface or object
